meanings.definition: The quality or state of being heavy.
meanings.sent1: The heaviness of the box made it difficult to lift.
meanings.sent2: I could feel the heaviness of the rock in my hand.
meanings.sent3: The heaviness of the rain clouds signaled a storm was coming.
meanings.sent4: The heaviness of the news weighed on her heart.
meanings.sent5: The heaviness of the silence in the room was palpable.

meanings.definition: The degree to which something is heavy.
meanings.sent1: She was surprised by the heaviness of the suitcase.
meanings.sent2: The heaviness of the snow caused the roof to collapse.
meanings.sent3: The heaviness of his backpack made him walk like a turtle.
meanings.sent4: The heaviness of the atmosphere indicated a storm was approaching.
meanings.sent5: The heaviness of the fog obscured everything in sight.

meanings.definition: The amount of weight or mass of an object.
meanings.sent1: The heaviness of the fruit basket made her arms ache.
meanings.sent2: He was surprised by the heaviness of the old book.
meanings.sent3: The heaviness of the grocery bags made her regret not taking a cart.
meanings.sent4: The heaviness of the anchor pulled the boat down into the water.
meanings.sent5: The heaviness of the package made it difficult to carry up the stairs.

meanings.definition: The quality of being oppressive or burdensome.
meanings.sent1: The heaviness of the workload stressed him out.
meanings.sent2: The heaviness of the secret she was keeping weighed on her mind.
meanings.sent3: The heaviness of the responsibility made him feel like Atlas.
meanings.sent4: The heaviness of the decision hung over them like a dark cloud.
meanings.sent5: The heaviness of the debt felt like a heavy chain around his neck.
